text: as for Russell Brand I think I
profoundly disagree says don't vote
that's his whole view don't vote it's a
you know it only encourages them or
something I mean though either it's
funny right it's funny but you know
politics and life and elections and jobs
and the economy it's not a joke Russell
Brand's a joke right ed Miliband hang
out with Russell Brand he's a joke this
is not funny this is about the election
this is about our future it's about jobs
about the economy is about the recovery
I haven't got time to hang out with
Russell Brand this is more important
these are real people these losers of
this election is all about now on the
taking demand out of the economy I tell
you the real threat to the recovery the
real threat is saying the deficit
doesn't matter right do you want to swap
our position for what's happened in
countries where they've not focused on
their deficit you know sometimes people
call this austerity I call it living
within our means if you don't live
within your means you end up broke all
right
that is what other countries have opted
for and I say we should never do it here
and frankly there is a threat it's not
just that Ed Miliband isn't interested
in the deficit and doesn't mention it in
his speeches there's a danger he would
go into alliance with Nicola Sturgeon
and Alex Salmond and the SNP who
actually said it is their aim to borrow
a hundred and ninety billion pounds more
and who is going to pay for that well I
tell you if it is your children and my
children growing up in a country with
overburdened debts massive debt interest
instead of investing in our hospitals
and our schools and our businesses we'll
just be sending you no deficit checks to
investors in China who wants to do that
with our money so let's have a sensible
plan two more years of saving one out of
every hundred pounds the government
spends to clear that deficit get that
debt interest bill down and spend the
money on here Britain hospitals schools
cutting your taxes that's what we should
be doing don't believe the politicians
who say the deficit doesn't matter they
only say that because they haven't got
the guts and the gumption to deal with
it well I have and it's important that
we do
